info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 12 at 5:42AM AKDT until April 13 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Snow and blowing expected. Storm total snow accumulations of about 2 to 6 inches. North to northwest winds gusting as high as 50-60 mph. Visibilities reduced to one-half mile or less at times.
* WHERE...Eastern Aleutians.
* WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility at times. Strong winds may cause damage or blow items around.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The first of two storm systems moves through today with the worst conditions focused primarily west of Unalaska this afternoon. The second system moves in quickly behind the first this evening with more widespread snow, blowing snow, and visibility reductions. The worst conditions with this system are expected this evening through Sunday morning before conditions begin to improve Sunday afternoon. Scattered snow showers will continue to linger through Sunday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Secure loose items that may be blown around by strong winds.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT SUNDAY
